intro: Doliocarpus chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocó doliocarpus, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy outer layer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
